item.title: [HELP] Java simple program [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Hard coding is awesome.
Also I wasn’t under the impression that you had to flush Scanners

Also just for the, I wrote this off the top of my head.

import java.util.Scanner;

public class NineQuestions {
	public static String[] QUESTIONS = {"Full name:", "age:", "location:", "come from where?", "hometown:", "job:",
				      "hobbies:", "first language:", "second language:"};

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		String[] information = new String[9];
		Scanner s = new Scanner(System.in);
		for (int i = 0; i < QUESTIONS.length; i++) {
			System.out.println(QUESTIONS[i]);
			information[i] = s.nextLine();
		}
		System.out.println("----------------");
		System.out.println("Output:");
		for (int i = 0; i < information.length; i++) {
			System.out.println(information[i]);
		}
	}
}

item.title: [HELP] Java simple program [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

My guess would be that the buffer isn’t being flushed, or you’re pushing enter twice and it will jump through them really fast.

Have you tried debugging it? Even simply printing out the variables at the end to see what went wrong would help

item.title: [HELP] Java simple program [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Ezpilz Ezpilz
item.description:
@Ezpilz wrote:

Hi all!

I was bored, then an idea comes to me and let me start doing a simple java blah blah …

anyways, C&P This code on ur IDE:

import java.util.Scanner;

public class MainClass{
	public static String Name;
	public static int Age;
	public static String Living_In;
	public static String Country;
	public static String HomeTown;
	public static String Job;
	public static String Hobbies;
	public static String First_Language;
	public static String Second_Language;

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Scanner s = new Scanner(System.in);
		System.out.println("-----------------------------------------------------");
		System.out.println("Please enter your full name: ");
		Name = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("Please enter your age: ");
		Age = s.nextInt();
		System.out.println("Where do you live currently? ");
		Living_In = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("Where do you come from? ");
		Country = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("What is your hometown? ");
		HomeTown = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("What is your job? ");
		Job = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("What is your hobbies? (E.G: Painting, Body building, etc..)");
		Hobbies = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("What is the first language you spoke?");
		First_Language = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("What is the second language you spoke? ");
		Second_Language = s.nextLine();
		System.out.println("-----------------------------------------------------");
	}

}

This is a small part of my fucked program … anyways:

All what i need you is to run it, and then when you enter them normally, you will get double questions, Like this:

Where do you live currently? 
Where do you come from?

How can i possibly fix this?
And could you post what the wrong code i did type?
I hope you understand me.

Read full topic
